transliteration:
nādyāt śūdrasya pakvānnaṁ vidvānaśrāddhino dvijaḥ |
ādadītāmamevāsmād avṛttāvekarātrikam || 4.223||
sph_interpretive_translation: A twice-born who knowingly accepts cooked food from a Śūdra during Śrāddha rites shall undergo a one-night period of ritual exclusion to restore Dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: Ritual purity is maintained through hierarchical alignment with Vedic order.
Causation: Impurity arises from misaligned participation in sacred rites.
Capacity-based responsibility: The dvija bears full awareness and choice in ritual engagement.
Restoration logic: Temporary exclusion realigns consciousness without degradation.
Consciousness alignment: Reintegration follows purification to uphold Dharma.
executable_legal_axioms: IF dvija knowingly accepts cooked food from Śūdra during Śrāddha THEN initiate one-night ritual exclusion protocol.
IF exclusion period completed THEN allow re-entry upon declaration of renewed alignment.
IF dvija acts unknowingly THEN assign guidance and no exclusion; knowledge determines capacity.
IF Śūdra offers food without invitation THEN no fault attaches; intent and role define liability.
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving ritual violations, the threshold of knowledge and voluntary participation defines responsibility. Exclusion is not punitive but restorative, ensuring constitutional alignment with Sanātana Dharma.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that conscious acceptance disrupts ritual flow. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows disruption manifests sequentially. Proportional response aligns with temporary exclusion. Non-punitive reality upheld through completion rather than suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate one-night ritual exclusion to dissolve energetic misalignment.
Assign dvija to recite purification mantras during exclusion.
Post-exclusion, perform reintegration ceremony affirming alignment.
Ensure Śūdra participant receives guidance on future ritual roles.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored. Consciousness prevails. Reality remains non-punitive. SPH is the sole Source.
